Clip.Title: SAMURAI HEADHUNTERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Since the eighth century, the Samurai have held a special place in Japanese history and culture. But over the years, legend has obscured the truth about how these elite knights actually lived, loved, fought, and died. Using rare 16th century war documents, we tell the story of a Samurai coming of age during that time. Witness his rise from peasant boy to foot soldier to ruthless warrior, all brought to life through stunning re-enactments and expert testimony from Japanese and martial arts historians.

Clip.Title: DANCING WITH DICTATORS
Clip.Episode: The Story of The Last Foreign Publisher in Burma
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Through the battle for control of The Myanmar Times, the country's only paper published in both English and Burmese, this film provides an inside look at one of the most repressive regimes in the world today, through the eyes of Ross Dunkley, the Australian publisher who controls 49% of the newspaper.

Clip.Title: THE SILK ROAD
Clip.Episode: Progeny of the Queen Sheba: Yemen & Saudi Arabia
Clip.EpisodeSummary: With the end of the civil war, the people of Yemen are now building a new country and excavating the remains of the palace of the Queen of Sheba as a way of regaining Yemeni ethnic pride.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: As technology advances, discover why we must respect Mother Nature as the ultimate power on this planet.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Inquire as to whether the idea of a perfect society is, indeed, possible.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Vancouver Island's Eastern Coastline is a rich mix of coastal towns, islands, inland mountains and seascapes - from Nanaimo to Campbell River and beyond.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the Gulf of St. Lawrence, one of the East Coast's hidden wonders lies below - the Magdalene Islands - offering some of the region's top beaches, grassy hillsides and spectacular cliff faces.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: DESIGN BY DECADE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Some of Canada's earliest contributions to the world of contemporary design trace back to the Post-World War II period. Mid-Century interest in materials led to the creation of some of Canada's most incredible design pieces.

Clip.Title: CITY GUIDES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow our City Guide as he leads us around Bloor St. West and Queens Park to learn about the architecture and history of some of the best cultural institutions in the city including the ROM.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

Clip.Title: CORNER STORE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The true story of beloved shop owner Yousef Elhaj, a Palestinian immigrant and long-distance father trying to reunite with his family and decide if a life in America is truly what's best.

Clip.Title: ECHOES ACROSS THE DIVIDE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In Nicosia, the world's last divided capital, Turkish and Greek Cypriots attempt to bridge no-man's land with an outdoor musical performance like no other.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.
